public static class Orenstein.OrensteinSA<T>
extends ImplementorBasedSweepArea<T>

The sweep area used by the Orenstein algorithm.

Creates a new OrensteinSweepArea. Uses an ArrayBag to store elements.

Parameters:
ID - ID of the SweepArea
initialCapacity - the initial capacity of the ArrayBag which is used for organizing the SweepArea
joinPredicate - the predicate of the join
Method Detail

reorganize

public void reorganize(T currentStatus,
                       int ID)
                throws IllegalStateException
In contrast to the method ImplementorBasedSweepArea.expire(Object, int), this method removes all expired elements from a SweepArea without returning them. The default implementation removes all elements returned by a call to ImplementorBasedSweepArea.expire(Object, int).
In order to perform a more efficient removal, this method should be overwritten, e.g., by implementing a bulk deletion.

Specified by:
reorganize in interface SweepArea<T>
Overrides:
reorganize in class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<T>
Parameters:
currentStatus - The object containing the necessary information to perform the reorganization step.
ID - An ID determining from which input this reorganization step is triggered.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - An UnsupportedOperationException is thrown, if is method is not supported by this SweepArea.
IllegalStateException - Throws an IllegalStateException if this method is called at an invalid state.

query

public Iterator<T> query(T o,
                         int ID)
This method counts the number of comparisons required for processing the query.

Specified by:
query in interface SweepArea<T>
Overrides:
query in class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<T>
Parameters:
o - The query object. This object is typically probed against the elements contained in this SweepArea.
ID - An ID determining from which input this method is called.
Returns:
All matching elements of this SweepArea are returned as an iterator.
See Also:
SweepArea.query(java.lang.Object, int)

insert

public void insert(T object)
Inserts the given element into this SweepArea. The default implementation simply forwards this call to the underlying implementor. Thus, it calls impl.insert(o).

Specified by:
insert in interface SweepArea<T>
Overrides:
insert in class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<T>
Parameters:
object - The object to be inserted.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if something goes wrong with the insertion due to the passed argument.
